snippet: A Kansas law requires towns to allow concealed weapons in public buildings but exempts them if they pay for additional security protections. Many are finding the measures to be prohibitively expensive.
abstract: Kansas law requires towns to allow concealed weapons in public buildings but exempts them if they pay for additional security protections; Wichita, state's most populous city, and some other towns have found that the cost of opting out is prohibitively expensive.
lead_paragraph: A Kansas law requires towns to allow concealed weapons in public buildings but exempts them if they pay for additional security protections. Many are finding the measures to be prohibitively expensive.

headline.main: Keeping Public Buildings Free of Guns Proves Too Costly for Kansas Towns
headline.print_headline: Keeping Public Buildings Free of Guns Proves Too Costly for Kansas Towns
